arm_group.arm_group_label: Long axis ultrasound placement of IV
arm_group.description: Long axis ultrasound placement of IV catheter

arm_group.arm_group_label: Short axis ultrasound placement of IV
arm_group.description: Long axis ultrasound placement of IV catheter

brief_summary.textblock:
Comparison of peripheral IV catheters inserted by ultrasound using the long axis vs. the
      short axis technique.  Our hypothesis is that long axis ultrasound placement will increase
      the longevity of the IV catheter.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Guided Peripheral Intravenous Catheter Insertion in the Hospitalized Patient: Long vs. Short Axis Placement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  A patient who needs PIV access for intravenous medications and resuscitation either
             on a medical-surgical floor or in the ICU

          -  After floor team (including RN and/or house staff) and IV Nurse have attempted and
             failed or is not available

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Need for vasopressors

          -  Need for TPN

          -  Need for hemodynamic monitoring

          -  Non English speaking patient

          -  Patients who are unable to consent

intervention.arm_group_label: Long axis ultrasound placement of IV
intervention.description: Peripheral IV placement with the ultrasound probe viewing the vessel in the long axis.

clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound Guided Peripheral Intravenous Catheter Insertion in the Hospitalized Patient: Long vs. Short Axis Placement

primary_outcome.description: How many catheters survived for 3 days or as long as they are needed.
